body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.38-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @pecanoro **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1761581386632969) ## Action Performed: 1. Create a new report 2. Add two non-reimbursable expenses 3. Set one expense as a positive amount and the other as a negative amount so that the report total equals $0 4. Attempt to submit the report. ## Expected Result: Reports with a $0 total should still be submittable as long as the expenses are valid and there are no blocking violations. ## Actual Result: The report cannot be submitted even though it contains valid expenses and no violations. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.38-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72086 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+2010021kh@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in with Expensifail account. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open the transaction thread. 5. Click More > Split. 6. Click Save. 7. Delete one of the splits. 8. On the remaining expense, click Amount. 9. Edit the amount and save it. ## Expected Result: After reverting split and editing amount, expense preview will not appear twice. ## Actual Result: After reverting split and editing amount, expense preview appears twice. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4d1ad629-8503-4b45-8327-80416a98ee39 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.31-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** N **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72177 **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND with a new private domain user 2. Enter the name 3. When prompted to join available workspaces, tap Skip 4. On the next screen, select Track and budget expenses. 5. On "Stay organized..." screen tap "Create workspace", continue 6. On "Invite members" screen tap Skip 7. Observe background of the "Test drive" screen, tap Skip ## Expected Result: User is not navigated to the self DM page after creating a workspace during onboarding ## Actual Result: New user is dropped in self dm first after creating a workspace during onboarding, then navigated to #admins ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.38-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176687/test-cases/41236712 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** na **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** IOS **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Use only expensifail account and don't use gmail account 4 accounts are needed for this TC: - Account A: Workspace owner (should invite following accounts) - Account B: Workspace approver (Should set an Account C as Vacation delegate) - Account C: Vacation delegate - Account D: Workspace submitter ***User D submitted an IOU to Workspace 1. Launch the IOS hybrid app 2. Log in as Account C (vacation delegate) 3. Go to the IOU that needs to be approved by Account B 4. Tap on the IOU details 5. Tap on any expand arrow (amount, description, date, category) ## Expected Result: Users should not be directed to Not here page, instead users should be directed to related page ## Actual Result: When users tap on the expand arrow under these section amount/ category/ description/ date, users directed to not here page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/45ce509d-6fff-4f28-b698-4227519db155 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Make More Features animation more obvious and add tap target

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

body:
## Problem We've seen user confusion when users go to add more features in the workspace editor not understanding what happens next. ## Solution 1. **Make feature tapable when enabled**. When a feature is enabled, we should make the left side of the container tapable to navigate to the feature while retaining the switch toggle to enable/disabled the feature 2. **Increase the timing of the animation to 10 seconds and change color to highlight color**. This'll ensure the highlight stays on the screen for longer increasing users visibility into the newly added feature. Current behavior: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/62148250-d64a-4d64-a343-d6e3d32532f6 In addition to making the fade-out delay animation 10 seconds, let's make a color change to our `highlight` color, that way we standardize to other patterns we have. Let's leave the rest of the animation alone as it's working well, only the fade-out delay time and the color should be tweaked on this element. cc @Expensify/design @puneetlath
